title: [Large-scale] Productive Failure-Based Programming Problem-Solving Workshop

context.prior_knowledge: Basic mathematical computational skills and comprehension of logical structures
context.additional_context: Smartphone-centric learning environment with real-time collaboration tools (e.g., Padlet).

learning_goals: Learners can convert given mathematical problems into algorithmic logic with over 80% accuracy.
Learners can generate revised code versions incorporating peer feedback through three or more iterative stages.
Learners can classify errors in problem-solving processes and propose five or more debugging strategies.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
